website_summaries.verdict: While they look good and have some nice features, they also have some reported issues.
pros: Owners are thrilled with how lightweight they feel and how attractive they look
cons: The nose guard has a tendency to come off, and the lenses are a bit difficult to change
Individuals with larger faces may find they run small

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses, DEFINITELY worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I saw complaints on here about only one polarized lense coming with the glasses... honestly, WHO CARES? You get FIVE lenses, all for different purposes (with directions as to what their intended use is). The frames themselves look great. They look great on, it comes with a soft cloth case, a hard shell case, a cleaning cloth... for $20, these glasses FAR exceeded my expectations. Will order another pair soon. As for the fit, I have a longer, thinner head. Saw some comments on here about people's heads getting squeezed by these. Mine has plenty of room on both sides. Actually bordering on too much room, but again... I'll blame that on my thin head.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ely

customer_reviews.title: Stick it to Luxotica and their $200/pp monopoly pricing.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome glasses. I lost a pair of ($200+) Oakley Radarlock glasses that I have been using for road biking for years. I bought these when they were promoted on Amazon, and frankly they are just as good if not better than the Oakleys for 1/10th the price. Finally someone is able to stick it to the Luxotica monopoly. I have already bought 2 other pairs of Torege glasses since, and am equally pleased with those. So far I am a very happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: ky_yaege

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Glasses, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I very seldom write reviews on anything, but I'm seriously impressed with these. The bang for your buck is incredible! Plus they look super sick with a white helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle & Jane

customer_reviews.title: durability issues.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box i "attempted" to swap the lenses just as the directions state (which include zero words mind you). the "flexible" plastic frame split over the left eye. the picture shows them bending and flexing as if they are indestructible ,but this is a gross exaggeration. it's to bad cause these glasses do look very nice. adjusted from one star to five due to the customer service being good. sent me a new pair and this one feels quite a bit more durable. defects happen,its how a company handles it that counts at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Jerico

customer_reviews.title: lousy customer service don't buy
customer_reviews.text: these glasses broke after just two months of limited use. they say they are lifetime warranty and contact seller which is amazon but amzn says torrege is the seller and they say contact amzn etc., ect. this endless tornado of crumy customer service means they got my 20 dollars and i got a broken pair of junky glasses . that one reviewer was right when he said the nubs break off. he was right .. DONT BUY THIS JUNK OR YOU WILL BE OUT 20 DOLLARS AND VERY UNHAPPY . remember, you can't contact customer service. there is no lifetime warranty. there isn't even a 3month warranty.
customer_reviews.author: HilbertsProtegesummacl

customer_reviews.title: Best all purpose glasses great price
customer_reviews.text: Tried out the blue mirrored lenses when the package arrived. Glasses themselves fit nicely on the bridge of your nose and above the ears. There is a carrying case with a clip, dividers for all the lenses, a string to attach to them so they don’t fly off riding, a towel to clean the lenses, a “how to” flyer on how to change the lenses and a little book on all the different lenses, what kinda lenses to wear in this or that situation. From clear, to tinted, to polarized lenses that actually work!!! Best all in one glasses, great price. Now to see how they hold up to baseball.
customer_reviews.author: Dlynn

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses for my motorcycle trips.
customer_reviews.text: Update: After just about month while changing lenses frame broke. This is very disappointing because I really like them they were great for bike rides.Thier lens changing "system" should be improved or make frame more flexible. Now I'm left with 5 lenses and no frame. Bummer Great glasses, good fit I use them for bike rides and I get no wind going into my eyes. Lenses give nice sharp crisp picture so I can see everything on the road. Definitely worth the money. I haven't tried the other lenses yet so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: SPARTAN

customer_reviews.title: Sleek but cheap
customer_reviews.text: I like all the lenses. The scratch fairly easy. Easier than the put on. The nose clip part that locks them into place come loose often. The quality is not there but what you would expect for the price. The polarization it on the black lenses and not on the red ones. At least the you couldn't see the card that they were talking about in the package with the red lenses. I would not buy again. The look was good, but quality not what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Paulk

customer_reviews.title: Great Glasses!
customer_reviews.text: These sunglasses are a great value! They look awesome and the interchangeable lens are very nice. I purchased two pairs, one for my husband and one for myself. We use the polarized lens while fishing and they work well. The lens are clear and and come clean easily with the cloth. These glasses are very comfortable. I love the cases that easily store all the different lens and the glasses when you are not wearing them. We have paid a lot more money for other sunglasses that are not near as nice as these sunglasses. Good buy! Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Amy D. Sward

customer_reviews.title: Fits Great
customer_reviews.text: Torege Polarized Sports Sunglasses - Black & Ice Blue lens FITS GREAT! I am a female and wear a size 7-1/4 hat, my head measures 22 inches around my eyes. True to picture, color, & description. Product Details: 1) Easy to clean 2) Great sun blockage, I have very sensitive eyes and I do not have to squint when in direct sunlight 3) Don't move or fog while running 4) Hair gets snagged on the end pieces (which is the only reason I gave it 4 stars b/c that really sucks) 5) I haven't tried to change the lenses, so I can't comment about that feature
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent, polarized lenses are black
customer_reviews.text: Decent but the removable nose guard which you need to pull off to replace the the installed (and desired colored lenses for the only polarized lenses which are black) is difficult to remove and it feels like they will be broken and the pictures in the instructions arent helpful. The locking mechanism is a raised tab, push it down to remove the nose guard or just keep pulling down even though it feels like it will break, I used a jeweler's flat head screwdriver and ruined the mechanism so it doesnt stay in place and rattles. If you can wear the oakley flak jackets they are about that long down your face and these will probably fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Vinal

customer_reviews.title: Nose Bridge Connection is Poor
customer_reviews.text: You have to remove the nose bridge to swap lenses. The first time, the nose bridge was tight, but after just two or three times, the nose bridge doesn't really want to stay on. UPDATE: The nose bridge is still loose, but the glasses are still functional ~ a year later. I have to be a little more careful handling the glasses when not being worn so that the bridge doesn't fall off, but when they're being worn, it does stay in place. If it weren't for the nose bridge issue, I'd give these five stars for functionality and value, but due to the issue, I will by trying a different pair of cycling glasses next time.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap looking
customer_reviews.text: I bought it after I saw it has good reviews. My husband hates it very much because it looks cheap and feels cheap. It should costs about $5. It looks like it's for a middle school kid. I'm returning it ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and they stay put!
customer_reviews.text: These sunglasses are awesome! They are inexpensive, fit beautifully and the wrap around offers excellent sun protection. The rigid case keeps my sunglasses protected when not in use. The lenses are slightly inconvenient to change, but not overly difficult. They do require a firm tug/pull to remove the nosepiece and then you can switch out the lenses. As I don't want to have to keep change lenses depending on the weather -sunny/cloudy/foggy--I just bought 2 pair. I have one pair with the polarized lenses and one with the amber lenses. That way I don't have to stop to change the lenses and then there's no concern about cleaning fingerprint smudges.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Marple

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted a cheap-ish pair of glasses for softball season and came across these that looked fine and had good reviews for a $20-30 price point. Was pleasantly surprised to find that it came with interchangeable lenses (as I couldn't be bothered to read the 100-word product title, and didn't really care enough to read through all the pictoral descriptions on the item's page). 5 lenses, they came shipped with the 2nd darkest inserted (the mirrored lens pictured in the main picture). The darkest lens is polarized, the other three lenses range from clear to hint-of-blue-tint to the yellow blueblocker style. Fit soundly and comfortable and lasted through a ballgame just fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice frame with a flawed design
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lense choices and nice frames. Light and just flexible enough. The strong pvc smell is not pleasant but probably will dissipate over time. As others have said, the instructions for changing the frames are useless. Use the helpful video another customer provided. My problem? The plastic nose bridge is huge! So big that it pokes into my ridge under the eye and at the edge of the nose. I couldn't possibly stand wearing them more than 2 or 3 seconds. Sadly they have to go back. If the manufacturer is reading this, hopefully you'll make a variety with a nose bridge that is more streamlined. Even a little change would help. Surprised no one else has mentioned....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT MIRRORED & CHEAP SQUEAKY PLASTIC
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black/white pair with red lenses. While the lenses ARE polarized (minimally), they are not mirrored. I specifically bought these for that purpose. Also, the plastic and hinges are so cheap, to the point where the entire pair of glasses creaks and squeaks whenever you fold/unfold them or put them on. I was so excited to get these delivered - what a major disappointment. Buyer beware: SOME of the selections state they are not mirrored, but this wasn't one of them. Turns out, they're probably ALL not mirror finishes. Word to the wise.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Gress

customer_reviews.title: Lens has changed in the last year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a replacement for an identical pair from 2018 that I loved. At some point, Torege has changed the lens tint from a dark smoke color to some horrific blue. It adds huge amounts of glare and makes everything seem over-bright. They gave me a headache after wearing for 20 minutes. The old lens was awesome. This version is a downgrade in every way. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: AaronZ

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, just question it’s durability
customer_reviews.text: I like the sunglasses and that it comes with multiple lenses. I don’t like the fact that the second time I tried to change the lens, the plastic broke on the edge. It still works, but I’ve literally had the glasses two days before it broke. The plastic also has rough edges as pictured. You can’t really tell, just makes me wonder about the quality and how long it will last since it already broke so fast Other than that it’s great and I like it. I’d give it 5 stars if it was more durable, but for the price it’s great. However for the price I’d expect it to last more than 2 days
customer_reviews.author: cire

customer_reviews.title: Great price, better fit!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are very similar in style to my Oakleys but way more comfortable. I don't know if I have a big head or not, but the Oakleys fit very tight and start to hurt after awhile, but these are very flexible and I can wear them way longer than other sunglasses I have owned. I love that it ships with replaceble lenses, but I love the blue ones that came installed by default and have yet to swap them out, but the fact that these glasses look nice, fit great and they send you different lens options for the price they charge is simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Pitchy

customer_reviews.title: Prefer them over Bolle Vigilantes
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I've been wearing Bolle Vigilantes for decades. But I got tired of shelling out 60+ dollars evert time I lose one (which, of late, has been yearly beginning of each Summer). These (with polarized lens) are as comfortable (although they feel slightly differnt) than the Bolle (without polarized lens) at a third od a price. Also, I ise them to play tennis and they feel more secure (the plastic is moldable, while Bolles are not) on me than the Bolle. I highly recommend them. As comfort of glasses are highly personal (depending, for one, one's facial structure. If you don't like em, return it (yeah, Prime!).
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: Nose piece not staying on after a while
customer_reviews.text: I liked the glasses, lenses are easy enough to change often as needed. I use mostly polarized lens and clear one for night time. After a while nose piece doesn't stay on. But that's what is securing the lens in place, so if it doesn't work glasses become useless. My lenses are in perfect condition, not worn or scratched, so i would otherwise get a lot more wear out of them. I would like to contact the seller gor a resolution, bit there doesn't seem to be a way to do it. So three stars for short life. Unless they fix this. It was a really weak point from the beginning and just got worse.
customer_reviews.author: icemom

customer_reviews.title: I just got them and so far I really like them. I have a small head and these ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got them and so far I really like them. I have a small head and these seem to work pretty well. I have to adjust a bit when I use with my bike helmet, but totally workable. The only thing I don't like is the smell. The coating on these has a weird smell to them that gives me a little of a headache. I'm hoping they air out quickly and it won't be an issue. I bought them mostly for bike riding and racing only. I have other glasses I use for running and triathlon, but if the smell dissipates, I'd consider using them for a sprint tri.
customer_reviews.author: Runner Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not sits on nose for asian faces. Bad UV lenses distorted.
customer_reviews.text: Not sits on nose for asian faces. If sits on nose, then tempera goes up to hair, not holding on ears. If tempera sits on ears, then glasses goes upper than nose and eyes. I've to bend tempera for ears down. When I went to hiking with UV block lenses after 30 minutes started feeling dizziness and eyes started to hurt. When I took glasses off, found that lenses distorting image, like cheap plastic. If needed can link images later.
customer_reviews.author: Dastan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for cycling, but only when humidity levels are low. I say this because on the more humid days, the lenses will fog up bigtime making them impossible to keep on.. other than that these are great! These come with 3 interchangeable lenses and high quality carrying case and cleaning cloth. At this price point I'm impressed with the quality! these will also work well for other recreational activities like quad biking, jet-skiing etc keeps glare out of your eyes but not so tinted that you have to take them off in shaded areas. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic glasses and Outstanding value!!
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight, come with three lenses and even fit my wide face! I wear these for cycling. The lenses are tall enough to protect my eyes from debris but still allow for good air flow around top, sides and bottom to prevent fogging from sweat. The mirrored lens provides great color rendering but my favorite is the polarized lens as it cuts down a lot of the glare I am subjected to while riding.... on those occasion I ride in the evening I will switch to the yellow lens for greater night vision. Can't believe they are so inexpensive!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: not flexible but deffinitly worth buying you get more then you should
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look of the glasses. also they came very quick. they were shipped and packaged very well and fast. also for the price, I cant believe how much you get for what you pay and its not some cheap case and pair of sglasses they are pretty nice quality. I would highly recommend this product. the only thing I have to say negative to the company is I don't feel you need to show that the glasses are super flexable because they are not. I believe your selling point is the product it self and your customer service. other then that I am very happy with this buy.
customer_reviews.author: MAC311

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Money (Esp Compared to IRL Shopping)
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pair of glasses and good price, I've seen similar sets (also off-brand) at stores for $50 and up. I've only used the mirror lens but it's great. Color distortion is slight and almost non-existent when looking directly ahead. I'm extremely sensitive to UV and these keep my eyes comfortable even in full Florida sunlight for several hours. They're super light and comfy and feel moderately sturdy, I'm going to go easy on them but I don't expect everyday wear and tear to break them anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: K. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you expect the orange lens to be polarized
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because it said polarized well it comes with like 5 different lenses and only one lens is polarized Wich are the black lens I expected the orange colored lens to be polarized and they are not that was why I wanted these glasses very disappointed for the fact the details are wrong ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the high star level and amount of positive reviews. First ride I was not impressed but I told myself I would try them out for a few weeks. Mine get fogged up easily and gather condensation on the outside of the lenses. I tried different positions and even pulled them down some but the condensation kept growing. I usually end up pulling them off during the ride cause my vision is hampered. They work great on cutting the sun and shine down but can’t see through them too well when they fog up. I’m off to find better ones!
customer_reviews.author: Derek J. Quackenbush

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses with great warranty! (This review is 1 year after purchase)
customer_reviews.text: My son has had these for a year so far. He plays baseball all year and works doing lawn care. These glasses have been great and held up really well. Just this week, his nose piece fell off during a baseball game and he couldn't find it. I contacted the company through Amazon and they were happy to send us a new nose piece as part of their lifetime breakage warranty. WOW! I definitely recommend buying these glasses from this great company!
customer_reviews.author: MWB6

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of sunglasses for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, for $20 bucks I have zero complaints. I needed a pair of sunglasses that I could wear with my bike helmet - these fit great. The tips don't interfere with the helmet at all, so they stay securely on my face. The nose-bridge is very comfortable as well. I haven't played around with the other included lenses (bonus), but the red one that came on it works great! I love that I don't have to stress about these. If I break/lose/whatever them, I won't care. I can't say the same thing about a $200 dollar pair of Oakleys! If you just need a casual pair of sunglasses ... give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: TedTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Lesson learned!!! The hinge on these are really cheap!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are made really really cheap! I never actually got to wear them outside before they broke in the hinge area. Lesson learned if i would have bought these from Walmart i would have taken them right back.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas George

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a hard shell case, cleaning cloth, extra nose piece (rubber), 2 backup lenses (not as nice as the main, but still nice they added those the package), and a pair of short sports croakies. Fits well on my big head. The lens looks great and does a nice job of covering your eyes all the way around so there is little to zero light coming in from the sides or the top and bottom. I've bought sunglasses for the same price (minus shipping) off the rack that were not nearly this nice. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: mr. ed

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these l, especially for the price. I have more expensive sunglasses and I prefer these over those most the time. I only use the other ones due to different outfits. I have the blue and white ones and they don't always go with some of the stuff I wear. Sun protection is great, night time is ok, about on par when switching to the yellow lenses. Just don't look right with the blue and white though, so don't use those much. Nice hard case that comes with them. In all honestly these things rock!
customer_reviews.author: Surenuff'

customer_reviews.title: GOOD product, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I like these sunglasses, but don't love them. The good: They're cheap. There's no metal in them, so no rust. They're comfortable. There are MANY lenses to choose from, including a super-dark lens for the Florida sun or in the sun with snow on the ground. The bad: The nose piece wears out quickly' The arms that attach to the frame wear down and eventually break off. I've had mine for 6 months and have had to JB Weld them back on, now I CAN NOT fold the arms inward, but they're still a joy to wear when I'm outside.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Finally Something Durable!
customer_reviews.text: These sunglasses are great. This is the second pair of Torege's I have ordered in the past year. I had issues in the past with other sunglasses that would crack within 9 months of use. The first pair still look great and are in perfect condition. I really like being able to change the lenses depending upon what I'm doing that day. It's very easy once you've done it a couple of times. I just wish the purple lenses of the new pair were more mirrored instead of see through. I would definitely recommend these to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: not polarized
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair for my husband and they included the little card with a picture that you can see to "prove" they are polarized. All three of the lenses failed the "test" We thought something was wrong with the card, but my kids sunglasses (all three of them) worked great and the picture showed up. SO, we requested a replacement. It arrived today and has the same problem. At this point, I have little faith that we'll get one that is polarized and will be returning them and buying the cheaper alternative that I bought for my kids. Apparently they actually work.
customer_reviews.author: MommyOf2Boys

customer_reviews.title: Simple but not great
customer_reviews.text: I understand the price.. you get what to pay for.. these are not bad but narrower than I was hoping.. ( height) but also cheap plastic.. they creak like and old wooden dock. For just simple sunglasses I’m sure they will do fine but I was looking for a pair for BeachVolleyball that I wouldn’t care if they got beat up.. they just don’t fit well on my head. I’ll use them for yard work.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Good sunglasses for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with these sunglasses, especially for the price Pros - Love the interchangeable lenses. They are easy to change. The first time I was afraid I was going to break them, but once you do it once it is easy - I used the yellow lenses when skiing recently, and I use the darker lenses for running/biking on sunny days Cons - They do feel like they could easily break. They have held up just fine for a month, but I do worry that they could snap/break. To be fair, this should be expected for the price point Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: J. Odell

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, I lost the first. They come with several plastic lenses of different colors and fit well. I ran races every other weekend from September to November last year and wore them to every one to keep my eyes from drying. Light blue on dark days and gray on bright days. Also good for cycling. No fogging at all and they did not fit loosely, but that might depend on the shape of your noodle. For the price, you can't go wrong. Nice case too.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the nose piece
customer_reviews.text: Excellent look, sun protection, and performance, but for the nose-piece. It's a soft rubber single item that attaches (in theory) to two plastic tabs on the inside of the nose portion of the frame. unfortunately, the attachment design has not been well worked out, and I'd say I have to reattach the nose piece at least once per bike ride. I'm not rough with my glasses, and in cycling, they do not get a lot of wear and tear. Other than that, they look great, the sun protection is superb, and I'd recommend them if you are able to remain patient enough to reattach the nose piece before every ride.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier. Based on some of the reviews I read before purchasing the product, I was skeptical due to mixed reviews. Package was nicely packed and everything was there, some of the items, I didn't even expect to come with. Additional lens we're secure or packed on a separate little carrier. Came with manuals, cloth carrying case, hard case, fiber cloth and a string.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Amazing goggles for a very good price
customer_reviews.text: These replaced a pair of Oakley goggles that I've had for a while which were finally falling apart. These Torege's seem very well made for the price and what you get for the money is simply amazing. They come in a hard case that has a nice zipper on it. Multiple lenses for various applications are included which also come in their own very nice soft pouch. You also get a micro fiber carrying bag and a micro fiber cleaning towel. All of that for only $22 which is simply amazing. In comparison, my old $160 Oakley's only came with two lenses and a cheap carrying bag. If you get these Torege's, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: This has been my favorite sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sunglasses almost 2 years ago. It has been my favorite sunglasses. It is very light weight. Lens replacement is very easy and the lenses provided allowed for changing to different lenses based on light intensity through out the day. I would use the yellow/orange lens at night to see better when playing tennis. The only complaint I have is the removeable nose piece, which has become very loose with use. Other than that, this is great sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: John Fang

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service, broke the frame after two years
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the title, I ended up breaking the frame after almost two years of heavy everyday use with my motorcycle helmet for commuting. Almost was about to order a new pair when I went back and checked the warranty card I still had in the box. Reached out to customer service and they issued a new one instantly. Had to write this review to share a good experience during these times. As far as the sunglasses go, they are amazing and do exactly what sunglasses do. Frame design is actually one of my favorites. Will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nishant Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Not bug proof
customer_reviews.text: As far as shades go, these are fine. They're comfortable and look nice and I haven't experienced them fogging up while riding my bike - even when I sweat. The reason for the 3 stars is bugs. Its super easy for tiny bugs to fly up under these glasses and get in your eye because the glasses aren't a snug fit to your face. I bought them to prevent that from happening so looks like I just threw away a few dollars - and now I'm outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fake warranty
customer_reviews.text: After a bike accident, I lost the nose piece off the glasses and I submitted a warranty claim to replace the nose piece. Even though they still make the same exact same glasses they wouldn’t honor the warranty saying that the glasses were somehow different now. They offered me a 50% off coupon for the purchase of new glasses. It feels like a bait and switch to me. Beware of the “lifetime warranty.”
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC
customer_reviews.text: I bought one pair a couple of months back and was happy with it so I bought a second pair. The quality control might not be very good and the second one I got does not fit well. The nose piece that’s supposed to lock back in place after changing the lens out won’t stray closed.
customer_reviews.author: Seven P.

customer_reviews.title: Different colored lenses are interchangeable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the sunglasses for my husband for Father’s Day. He didn’t like the glasses at all. The thing with interchangeable lenses confused him and he was mad that I would buy him something like that. He’s 84 and with arthritis in his hands, changing lenses just annoyed him. Obviously, I felt really bad! So I have to return them. I thought they looked cool. They are lightweight and really stay on. But, they weren’t for my much older husband. Still feeling bad about it!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Great for blocking wind
customer_reviews.text: I am not a review writer but I felt compelled to for this product. I’m a female cyclist and in the winter months I can’t seem to do anything about my eyes tearing up, especially on down hills. I just purchased these and took them out for a test ride. It was cold and even during the top speeds I didn’t tear up once! The wind blocking is awesome and worth it enough for me. And there was no fogging! Also I’m not sure how people broke them so easily but I handled them with care and easily already changed out the lenses. I’m so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but fell apart.
customer_reviews.text: The fit is great and the multiple lenses are great for different situations. After 6 wears, the arm dislodged and fell about 4 feet to the pavement and the end cracked. I consider myself very careful, always keeping the glasses in the great hard case provided, so I'm not sure why or how the arm was able to dislodge. I'm trying to activate the warranty, but Torege website won't load.
customer_reviews.author: Tina W

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and they work too!
customer_reviews.text: So used these for playing ball, driving, and just hanging out and they do the job very well. Blue lenses are great for softball and tennis and on very sunny bright days the darker ones work very well for tennis serves and overheads. Yellow are great for driving. My only issue is a minor one, hard to figure out how to change lenses, not quite intuitive even woth included card and web check. But I recommend these for almost everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Chefjimi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for cycling in all types of weather!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these sunglasses that I've purchased because I love them so much. They are perfect for cycling in any kind of weather, particularly for road areas spotted with both shade and sun (when it's typically difficult to see hazards in the road). The field of vision is crisp and clear. The edges extend to the sides of the face to prevent excessive sun exposure, bugs, and rain around the eyes. And the shading in the lenses that come with the glasses (rather than with the selection of alternative lenses) doesn't obscure the natural color of things...images are sharp and true. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great looking sports sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: I was wondering how good this pair of glasses would be. I was considering buying Oakley, but those are quite pricey and come with only one lens. These come with 5 lenses, granted that I may use one or two most often, but I still have the option of using the others. The poly-carbonate polarized one is very good, so even if the glasses came only with that lens, they are still great for the money. I did not have a problem with the nose piece as other reviewers have mentioned yet. If I have it, I will come and revise my review, but if they last a couple of years I am more than happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new pair of biking goggles. The Torege sunglasses seemed like a nice and low-priced option. Item arrived quickly but I just could not get them to fit at all. The arms would lift the frame up so that it could not rest on the nose. Result was a very wiggly fit making them completely useless for any kind of physical activity. I was unable to bend the arms to make them fit any better. Returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Good Selection
customer_reviews.text: These glasses I found were a bit too small for my head so I do not wear them as much as I would like to but they do look nice and they are fairly easy to switch out between the different lenses that come with the case. If they were just a little bit larger, I would have worn them more and then actually be able to touch on their comfort level for wearing them for extended periods of time and how well they work. But from my limited use, they seemed to be ok glasses that are fairly durable.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: The best outdoor sunglasses money can buy
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I got these pair of glasses. After several glasses along the years, these are the first sunglasses that feel SO comfortable while riding my bicycle. Simply perfect fit and design. Other outdoor glasses, even expensive ones, at some point become foggy while exercising, not these ones. The fact one can switch the glasses to adapt to different light conditions is a big plus. It comes with a nice case, pouch and cleaning cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Meteoro

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect Oakley’s but whatta deal!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic holiday gift for the sunglass lover! Pros/ Accessories galore, very nice presentation as a gift, ease of switching out lenses, and does what it’s supposed to do And yes stunning colors with the ice blue and white combo. Cons/The frame is Walmart quality and we shall see on longevity and durability and I just received them. I play tennis and I have a ranch so they will get quite a workout. I will update soon.
customer_reviews.author: Tennis lovr

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for the first time this past weekend. I changed out the lenses that were in the frame to the dark grey lenses because I was at the beach in bright sunshine. It took me a couple of minutes to change the lenses and it was easy to do. I was faster the second time when I did it the second time. They fit comfortably and stayed on my head the entire time I was active playing volleyball. Great filed of view and glare/light/UV blocking.
customer_reviews.author: SFE7

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens, frames bad
customer_reviews.text: These glasses come with 5 different lens. I've worn the yellow, blue, and polarized. The lens are not bad. However, the frames are terrible. The hinges are just pastic connections which I have a feeling they will break any time now. The frames are also slightly bent so it feels like they are always sitting slanted on your face. You can look at your eyebrow line and see that they are crooked. Ive had this happen to me in the past with cheaper glasses. They do have a lifetime warranty on the frames and I have not yet used this.
customer_reviews.author: Ricco

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em!
customer_reviews.text: they offer good eye protection against the sun, flying insects, and tree branches. really flexible with the interchangeable lenses which are easy to change quickly. they are unbreakable so far. very light weight and comfortable, and have plenty of flexibility in the frame to be "one size fits all" .....and they look AWESOME which is very important when bike riding.
customer_reviews.author: FM1

customer_reviews.title: Only came with 3 lenses-Red, grey, yellow
customer_reviews.text: These are good for the money. First pair ordered earlier this year came with 5 different lenses including a clear one that I used the most. After losing them i ordered another pair and they only came with 3 lenses: a red, yellow, and grey. The style of the frame changed also. My other lenses don't fit the new frames. Now I have to buy a pair of clears to wear in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: M. Steger

customer_reviews.title: Nice but they fog up bigtime
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for the price, but fits fairly close to the face and fogs up badly. Kept having to take them off when I did slow climbs due to serious fogging and ultimately lost them when they fell off my pack (not the product's fault). Now looking for something that sits far enough away from my face to allow some airflow.
customer_reviews.author: dedjr

customer_reviews.title: Look forward to using this product.
customer_reviews.text: They fit well and seem pretty durable and somewhat flexible. I like that 5 different lenses are all included, since I will need at least 3 of them for different things. My only issue came with the shipping, which I'm. It sure who the blame goes to. The glasses or extra lenses did not suffer any damage, however the included protective case was damaged whenever I opened the box.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl8784

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied with fit
customer_reviews.text: I can only give the item A star OR two due to the fact that they are marketed under Cycling and out door sunglasses and the frames are so long (the ear pieces) that they DO not fit under two different name brand cycling helmets. I have tried to figure out how to make them work but can’t recommend if you are looking for them to be cycling specific sunglasses
customer_reviews.author: AndrewH

customer_reviews.title: Good design poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great design and very convenient. The piece that holds the lenses in broke after relatively few uses (I changed the lenses 10 - 12 times if that.) But am encouraged by the gaurantee. It wasn't easy to find on the website (the FAQ actually misdirects you) but I am hopeful. Will keep you updated. Update. Amazing customer service. They responded quickly and are fixing it right away!! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Nice glasses, nose piece could be a little more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I do like these glasses, the only reason for 4 stars is the nose piece came off after about a dozen uses. It's no big deal, I just used a little gorilla super glue and haven't had a problem since.
customer_reviews.author: jmarb

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for budget friendly cycling glasses and landed here. These have not disappointed at all. The lenses are a bit fidgety to replace the first time (with no usable instructions in the package) but once you figure out how to pull out the bridge while slightly squeezing, there really aren’t any other worries. Since I do woodwork at times, the inclusion of the clear lenses makes these my go-to for that as well. Two for the price of one!
customer_reviews.author: Machel

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and not too dark
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and blocks glare from the sun. My son plays first base and has had a hard time seeing the ball at certain times of the day. He needed sunglasses that were not to dark and still blocked sun glare. After a few pairs of glasses, these unded up being the one that he felt were the best. He said they were light weight, stayed in place and enhanced his vision. That is what he need.
customer_reviews.author: Sean O

customer_reviews.title: I found it difficult to find a comfortable pair of riding glasses until I found these
customer_reviews.text: I found it difficult to find a comfortable pair of riding glasses until I found these. With the purchase I received multiple lenses, lanyard, travel case, and cleaning cloth. The frame is very flexible and I wear them without any pressure to the side of the head. They are also light weight which means that they don't apply pressure to the bridge of my nose like my other glasses. This was a great buy and I would by again, and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT glasses for the price. I am sure you could pay a lot more for a more sophisticated pair of sports glasses, but I have used these regularly for two years while biking and they are very effective in diminishing the glare, allowing for clear vision, and in keeping dust out of my eyes. After two years, why am I writing now? Because the nose piece broke and I wrote to Torege to ask if I somehow get a replacement frame. They responded very quickly and (after I submitted verification of my original purchase) sent me a new pair! I was so impressed and grateful for their excellent customer service. I am a dedicated Torege fan!
customer_reviews.author: DEM

customer_reviews.title: Good glasses
customer_reviews.text: Really nice package for a price. Case is hard enough and has a nice little hook to be attached to the backpack or such. I found the blue lens most useful in the rain and the yellow during the night for driving but it gets a little bit of time to use to the different picture. The soft case and the cleaning patch Olsen knives super soft microfiber replacement is not exactly easy for the lens but after few tries you will get a hold of it
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Z

customer_reviews.title: Nice glasses
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd pair of these i have ordered in the past 6 months. The lenses hold up very well for not getting scratched. I am rough on sunglasses and need to where dark lenses outside. The fit and wrap around coverage is great. Better than the oakleys i had preiously that had obnoxious frame pieces that were always distractions in peripherals. The options lenses swap outs are easily changed out for different uses. I now ise my old pair with the yellow lense for night driving.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Neuville

customer_reviews.title: THESE GLASSES ARE NOT, I REPEAT NOT POLARIZED SUNGLASSS
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these glasses about 4 times. They block the sun fairly well but since they are not polarized they allow glare in oncoming vehicles and rear windshields of cars in front of you. I have owned polarized sunglasses in the past and these are not. I purchased these sunglasses because I have sensitive eyes to bright light.
customer_reviews.author: sidewalksam

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the ease of switching lenses!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these for biking and skiing! They keep sun, wind, bugs and other nasty stuff (mud) out of my eyes. I switch lenses around before each workout and it's easy. The case is great for holding all the lenses and keeping them from getting scratched. Great price point for great glasses. If I lose them I'll buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Muniz

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I like these as much as I do
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I like these as much as I do. Bought them to have something inexpensive for playing golf. I had been wearing some Maui Jim's, but was concerned about scratching the lenses since I have to clean them so often due to perspiration in the summer. Bottom line is that these are comfortable, stylish and provide the right amount of wrap around (about 1/4 inch more than my Maui's). Very tempted to buy a couple more colors while they are available.
customer_reviews.author: Terri B

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, versatile, worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, it comes in a hard case that is worth more than half the price tag alone. That is amazing. Secondly, I mistakenly thought it only comes with ONE colored lens. IT DOESN'T! It comes with ALL the colors! They are amazing!! They really do make this one set of sunglasses the only set you'll ever need and I plan to use it frequently! They cannot fit over a pair of glasses but I'm assuming you'd already know that just by reading the description. An amazing value for the price and I'll be sure to buy again for gifts. The nose-rest/guard is also comfortably padded rubber, and it feels better than my regular glasses by FAR. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: derp

customer_reviews.title: Good cycling shades, lenses break easily
customer_reviews.text: These are solid shades for cycling or running. My only gripe is they're my 4th pair in 2 years. I love the default lens (as shown in the photo) but I've broken the lens on so many pairs now. I guess I'm hard on my stuff. That said, they ship them with 3-4 additional lenses: Yellow, clear, black, and one other. I wish they just included a few replacement, original lenses instead. The other gripe I have is they're overpackaged with a ton of extra stuff in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: At least they don’t cost much...
customer_reviews.text: The interchangeable lenses and lens quality is great for the money. The frames are sketchy for a number of reasons. Removing and clipping in lenses feels like a gamble every time as the plastic and design is quite lackluster. The rubber ear pads I super glued to keep them in place. I wouldn’t get these or recommend them, however they do work so hey’
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Works for Me
customer_reviews.text: I wear transition glasses. But I cant play golf in them. My eye doctor said I should ware sunglasses so I bought these. Very light weight to the point of forgetting you have them on. I tried all three lenses and the blue ones work for me. The polarizing lenses really helps . If they could lower my scores I would give them 7 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Great value glasses. I was surprised by the quality of the frames, the ease of swapping lenses, and the quality of the lenses. The polarization on the one lens is fantastic compared to my more expensive name brand glasses. The case is very nice, but I primarily use it to hold the variety of lenses that come with the glasses. Overall I am happy with these and would recommend them to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Nice glasses but not durable and no customer support
customer_reviews.text: The nose piece fell off after 2 months and would not stay on. Contacted customer support and sent pictures--no reply. I wish the quality was better because other than that I liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Engineerrock

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great value pair of sunglasses. The lenses are easy to remove. The quality of the lenses isn't fantastic but i didn't expect them to be super durable for 20$. I would buy these again. I use them for running, cycling and as safety glasses for shooting sports.
customer_reviews.author: TriKen

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, well packaged
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have involves changing the lenses. There is a simple diagram that shows how it should be done. I attempted to follow the diagram instructions, didn’t work. Since I don’t want to break the glasses I just left the original lens in place. Better, written instructions would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: mnord

customer_reviews.title: Only black lens is polarized.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for cycling, came with two extra shades, blue and yellow are just tinted, the black is polarized. I only use the black which is polarized, very comfy, light weight, fits pretty well. I love it. The blue shade has the best quality lense though I do recommend these pair of shades, reasonable price , and good built quality.
customer_reviews.author: AYMEN3M

customer_reviews.title: These sunglasses are amazing! They filter light very well
customer_reviews.text: These sunglasses are amazing! They filter light very well! The 4 different interchangeable lenses are a definite plus! Each lens has its own filtering capability and there really is a difference! The lenses are easily removed and replaced. The frames are very fashionable and are really light and comfortable. The case that came with the glasses is well worth what the glasses and lenses cost! Great value and a super product!
customer_reviews.author: Grace's D

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.  Marketing/ Consumer Education Needs Improvement
customer_reviews.text: The actual product is good quality, however I had to search out a YouTube video to learn how to change the lenses (the directions were not included in the insert that described the lenses, which came with the sunglasses). I sent a pair of these to a friend - I knew the sunglasses would be a hit (and they were) however no instructions were included re: changing the lenses (thank goodness for YouTube). Please improve your marketing/ consumer information.
customer_reviews.author: SGC

customer_reviews.title: Solid glasses
customer_reviews.text: I do like this glasses - unfortunately they are just a little off balance so I am constantly adjust them because the right arm sits a little higher than the left. Not a big deal but a bit annoying at times. Also, they constantly come loose at the nose bridge where you "unlock" them to change the lenses. Even though they were priced decently - i probably wouldn't purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Leggett

customer_reviews.title: “Polarized” in name only
customer_reviews.text: First of all, for the price, these sunglasses are good. They seem relatively sturdy, considering the fact they’re made of a rigid plastic. Colors are great. Extra lenses for various needs is also great. The main negative is the use of the word “polarized.” The purpose of me needing polarized sunglasses is to protect my eyes from UV light. These glasses only make things darker. I verified with an optometrist that these glasses are NOT polarized.
customer_reviews.author: Reading to Exercise My Little Brain

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: For the price I really like these sunglasses. Interchangeable lenses. My eyes tend to water when wind gets to them. I had no issues with my first ride with these glasses. They are light weight. They feel a bit cheap, but hey they didn't cost much at all and work very well. I'd definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Much approval
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my sister as an early Christmas present when she lost her other sunglasses during Halloween. Immediately upon opening the box... "Ooooooo!" Immediately after putting them on with the polarized frames... "Ahhhh!!!" Yes, I think we have a winner!
customer_reviews.author: s34w33d

customer_reviews.title: Great To Reduce Glare
customer_reviews.text: These are great to reduce glare, but the lenses do tend to distort things just slightly. For just being outside or driving, they're great. For something like golf, they won't provide the kind of contrast to see the ball against the sky like a better quality lens. I still consider them great value.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Miller

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: In theory, these are a great idea. But it's very difficult to change the lenses, and even more difficult to get the nose piece -- which helps hold the lenses in place -- to stay on. I gave up on trying to change the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Wostambu

customer_reviews.title: Do the job well
customer_reviews.text: I ride in all types of weather day and night and am planning a bike tour. Having as little as possible with me is ideal. These glasses are not the lightest out there but lightweight enough and much easier to swap lenses as needed than I expected! For the price point, I don't mind the little extra weight. I've had rides end badly because a bug got in my eyes and as a contact-wearer that is simply no good. I use the polarized and clear lenses almost exclusively. They come in a hard case with a drawstring bag and glasses wipe, perfect for tossing in a bag when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Forster

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is awesone!
customer_reviews.text: I got the set of lenses and glasses in a few days. Initially, I had difficult time figuring out how to change lenses. I even went to youtube to see a video. Once I figured it out it was a breeze. The polarized lens had a small defect. I contacted TOREGE and they responded immediately by replacing the glasses. I absolutely love them. I play outdoor raquet sports and they are really nice. Lightweight and fit very snuggly. The price was great too. If you play pickleball, you will want to get this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dawni

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, many options for lenses included
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, many options for lenses included. Hard carrying case with lens cloth and soft bag are all included and seem to be well made. Lens changes are not difficult to complete. 4 star given for the fact that there was a plastic smell that was VERY strong for a few weeks and the ice blue lens not being polarized (not advertised that it was, just a way to make the product better).
customer_reviews.author: Sam Horn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that for $21 you get a nice case, different lenses and nice looking pair of glasses that stand out. The only reason its not a five star is that the nose bridge is not the most comfortable, but not enough not to purchase. You can buy it and give it as a gift to a runner, biker, or beach bum. Worth the purchase. They give lifetime warranty as I read on the back of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery! nicely packaged! and a GREAT deal! sunglasses only get 4 star BECAUSE I'm not too sure of the frame foundation.... possible to break if you don't secure them after use. i WOULDN'T recomend for bike riders joggers these are more for chillin at the beach, driving or any other non physical activity ... outdoors fashion in the sun my opinion DOES provide vision protection.
customer_reviews.author: Air show 23

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better even at three times the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been an Oakley fan for 25 years, they were the only sunglasses I'd buy until these. I even get a substantial discount on Oakley because of my job but I won't buy another set. Wore these while mountain biking some challenging trails today. They did a great job with contrast making it easier to pick my lines they also stayed put on my face. 100 percent satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kim and Nelson

product_meta.title: Torege Polarized Sports Sunglasses With 3 Interchangeable Lenes for Men Women Cycling Running Driving Fishing Glasses TR002
feature_bullets: THREE INTERCHANGEABLE LENS- All the lens 100% UV400 protection coating, blocks 100% harmful UVA & UVB Rays. Restore true color, eliminate reflected light and scattered light，make the scenery more clear and soft and protect eyes perfectly. The Main one is colourful lense ,the yellow one is for night activities,the balck one is polarized for driving and other activities.

CLEAR, SUPERLIGHT, STYLISH AND DURABLE- Cool Rimless jacket frame design enables clear lower vision field. Lightweight design is ideal for motorcycle and cycling bicycle, driving, running, fishing, racing, skiing, climbing, trekking or other outdoor activities. Fashion and stylish design, with rich color combinations of frames and lens. Polycarbonate lens and frames are impact, scratch resistant, durable and unbreakable.
TWO SOFT RUBBER NOSEPAD,Let Your Nose Feel Comfortalbe While Wearing Torege Sports sunglasses for Cycling Running Fishing Golf .

LIFETIME BREAKAGE WARRANTY ON FRAME- Frames and lens are unbreakable for no risk purchasing. In case any broken problem happens, contact the seller of Torege without hesitation to solve the problem until satisfaction. Torege provides lifetime after sale service for all Torege products.

30 DAY MONEY BACK GUARANTEE- All Torege customers enjoy 30 Day Money Back Guarantee. Customers can return and get refunded in case the purchasing is not satisfactory for any reason. You have no risk to try.
